javadoc:
Class with static methods to create a JButton with a raised bevel border,
 and to create a JPanel with buttons created by calling the 
 createButton() method.

methods.javadoc:
Create a button with specified type.
@param buttonType the type of button to create.
methods.name: createButton
methods.comment: Create a button with specified type.

params.name: buttonType
params.comment: the type of button to create.

methods.javadoc:
Create a button with the given text.
@param text the text to use in the button.
methods.name: createButton
methods.comment: Create a button with the given text.

params.name: text
params.comment: the text to use in the button.

methods.name: createButtonPanel
methods.comment:
Create the panel for the buttons; the button are aligned vertically;
 the side margins on the panel has a default value of 20.

params.name: buttons
params.comment: the array of buttons to put in the panel.

methods.name: createButtonPanel
methods.comment:
Create the panel for the buttons; the button are aligned as specified;
 the side margins on the panel has a default value of 20.

params.name: buttons
params.comment: the array buttons to put in the panel.

methods.name: createButtonPanel
methods.comment:
Create the panel for the buttons; the button are aligned vertically;
 use sideMargin value for side margins on the panel.

params.name: buttons
params.comment: the array buttons to put in the panel.

params.name: sideMargin
params.comment: the amount of margin space to use on the sides.

methods.name: createButtonPanel

params.name: buttons
params.comment: the array buttons to put in the panel.

methods.name: createImageButton
methods.comment: Create an button that has an icon created from the given imageFile.

params.name: alternateText
params.comment: text to use if the icon could not be loaded

params.name: preferredSize
params.comment: size that the button would like to be

methods.name: createImageButton
methods.comment: Create a button with the given icon.

params.name: alternateText
params.comment: text to use if the icon could not be loaded

params.name: preferredSize
params.comment: size that the button would like to be

name: ButtonPanelFactory
comment:
Class with static methods to create a JButton with a raised bevel border,
 and to create a JPanel with buttons created by calling the 
 createButton() method.

fields.javadoc:
layout the buttons on the panel created with createButtonPanel()
 horizontally along the X-axis
fields.name: X_AXIS
fields.comment:
layout the buttons on the panel created with createButtonPanel()
 horizontally along the X-axis

fields.javadoc:
layout the buttons on the panel created with createButtonPanel()
 vertically along the Y-axis
fields.name: Y_AXIS
fields.comment:
layout the buttons on the panel created with createButtonPanel()
 vertically along the Y-axis

fields.javadoc: Button that has an up arrow.
fields.name: ARROW_UP_TYPE
fields.comment: Button that has an up arrow.

fields.javadoc: Button that has a down arrow.
fields.name: ARROW_DOWN_TYPE
fields.comment: Button that has a down arrow.

fields.javadoc: Button that indicates a file chooser to browse.
fields.name: BROWSE_TYPE
fields.comment: Button that indicates a file chooser to browse.

fields.javadoc: Button that indicates an edit operation.
fields.name: EDIT_TYPE
fields.comment: Button that indicates an edit operation.

fields.javadoc: Button that has a left arrow.
fields.name: ARROW_LEFT_TYPE
fields.comment: Button that has a left arrow.

fields.javadoc: Button that has a right arrow.
fields.name: ARROW_RIGHT_TYPE
fields.comment: Button that has a right arrow.

fields.javadoc: Font for the browse button label.
fields.name: BROWSE_FONT
fields.comment: Font for the browse button label.

fields.javadoc: internal values used when creating the panels and buttons
fields.name: TOP_MARGIN
fields.comment: internal values used when creating the panels and buttons
